intro: Megarrhiza californica, commonly known as the California megarrhiza, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy surface. Megarrhiza californica is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
